trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest"></xref> class determines whether the directory object holds the specified value for the attribute.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest"></xref> class using the specified distinguished name and attributes.
This constructor creates an object that compares `attributeName` on the object `distinguishedName`.
The distinguished name of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object to compare.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object.
assertion contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
assertion must contain exactly one value.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Byte[])"></xref> constructor creates an instance of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest"></xref> using the specified distinguished name, attribute, and attribute value.
This constructor creates an object that compares `attributeName` on the object `distinguishedName` against `value`.
The distinguished name of the object to compare.
The name of the attribute to compare.
The value to compare.
attributeName or value contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest"></xref> class using the specified distinguished name, attribute, and attribute value.
This constructor creates an object that compares `attributeName` on the object `distinguishedName` against `value`.
The distinguished name of the object to compare.
The name of the attribute to compare.
The value to compare.
attributeName or value contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Uri)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest"></xref> class using the specified distinguished name, attribute, and attribute value.
This constructor creates an object that compares `attributeName` on the object `distinguishedName` against `value`.
The distinguished name of the object to compare.
The name of the attribute to compare.
The value to compare.
attributeName or value contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest.Assertion"></xref> property gets the attribute/value pair used to compare.
The attribute/value pair used to compare.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest.DistinguishedName"></xref> property gets or sets the distinguished name of the object to compare.
The distinguished name of the object to compare.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CompareRequest.ToXmlNode(System.Xml.XmlDocument)"></xref> method creates an XML node from the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
The resulting <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object must contain exactly one value.
